question_text: In the diagram above, PQ = 4 cm and TS = 6 cm. If the area of parallelogram PQTU is 32 cm2, find the area of the trapezium PQRU
subject: mathematics
explanation: Area of parallelogram PQTU = base * height 32 = 4 * hw = 32/4w = 8 ∴ = Area of Trapezium PQRU = (1/2)(4 + 14) *8= 1/2 * (18 * 8)= 72 cm2

explanation: The diagonal QS bisects the angle formed by PQ and QR∴ [A]

question_text: P, R and S lie on a circle center as shown above while Q lies outside the circle. Find ∠PSO
subject: mathematics
explanation: x\(^{\circ}\) = 35 + 29 (Exterior angle = sum of two interior opposite angles)x = 55\(^{\circ}\) (∠ at the center twice ∠ at circumference) y = 110\(^{\circ}\)∠PSO = ∠SPO (base ∠S of 1sc Δ b/c PO = SO)∴ ∠PSO = (180 - 110)/2= 35\(^{\circ}\)

question_text: The locus of a point which is 5 cm from the line LM is a
subject: mathematics
explanation: The locus of a point which is 5cn from the line LM is a pair of lines on opposite sides of LM and  parallel to it, each distance 5cm from LM

options.answer: line distance 10 cm from LM and parallel to LM
pair of line on opposite sides of LM and parallel to it, each distance 5 cm from LM
line parallel to LM and 5 cm from LM
pair of parallel lines on one side  of LM and parallel to LM

question_text: If y = 3 cos(x/3), find dy/dx when x = (3π/2)
subject: mathematics

question_text: Find the derivatives of (2 + 3x)(1 - x) with respect to x
subject: mathematics

question_text: Find the derivatives of the function y = 2x2(2x - 1) at the point x = -1
subject: mathematics

question_text: Evaluate \(\int_{1}^{3}(X^2 - 1)dx\)
subject: mathematics

question_text: Some white balls put in a basket containing twelve red balls and sixteen black balls. If the probability of picking a white balls from the baskets is 3/7, how many white balls were introduced?
subject: mathematics
explanation: Number of white balls = xNumber of red balls = 12Number of black balls = 16Total number of balls = 28 + xP(white balls) = 3/7But P(white balls) \(= \frac{x}{28+x}\\= \frac{3}{7} = \frac{x}{28+x}\\3(28 + x) = 7x\\84 + 3x = 7x\\7x - 3x = 84\\4x = 84\\x = 21\)

question_text: find the mean deviation of 1, 2, 3 and 4
subject: mathematics

question_text: An unbiased die is rolled 100 times and the outcome is tabulated above. What is the probability of obtaining a 5?
subject: mathematics
explanation: Number of times 5 was obtained = 20 P(obtaining 5) = 20/100= 1/5

question_text: The pie chart above shows the distribution of the crops harvested from a farmland in a year. If 3000 tonnes of millet is harvested, what amount of beans is harvested
subject: mathematics
explanation: Sectorial angle of beans = 360 - (150 + 90 + 60)= 360 -300= 60\(^{\circ}\)if 150\(^{\circ}\) represents 3000 tonnes1\(^{\circ}\) 3000/15060\(^{\circ}\) will represents (3000/150) * (60/1)= 1200 tonnes

question_text: In how many ways can2 students be selected from a group of 5 students in a debating competition?
subject: mathematics

question_text: The mean age of a group of students is 15 years. When the age of a teacher, 45 years old, is added to the age of the students, the mean of their ages becomes 18 years. Find the number of the students in the group
subject: mathematics
explanation: Let the number of students = xTotal age of the students = 15xTotal age including age of the teacher = 15x + 45Mean of their ages; (15x + 45)/(x + 1) = 18= 15x + 45 = 18(x + 1)= 15x + 45 = 18x + 18= 18x - 15x = 45 - 18= 3x = 27x = 9

question_text: A container has 30 gold medals, 22 silver medals and 18 bronze medals. If one medals is selected at the random from the container, what is the probability that it is not a gold medal?
subject: mathematics
explanation: Gold medals = 30silver medals = 22Bronze medals = 18/70P(Gold medals) = 30/70 = 3/7∴ P(not Gold medal) = 1 - 3/7= 4/7

question_text: A committee of six is to be formed by a state governor from nine state commissioners and three members of the state house of assembly. In how many ways can the members of the committee be chosen so as to include one member of the house of assembly
subject: mathematics

question_text: The weight of 10 pupils in a class are 15 kg, 16 kg, 17 kg, 18 kg, 16 kg, 17 kg, 17 kg, 17 kg, 18 kg, and 16 kg. What is the range of this distribution?
subject: mathematics

question_text: I. Rectangular bars of equal widthII. The height of each rectangular bar is proportional to the frequency of the corresponding class interval.III. Rectangular bars have common sides with no gaps in betweenA histogram is described completely by
subject: mathematics

question_text: y = is inversely proportional to x and y = 4 when x = 1/2. Find x when y = 10.
subject: mathematics

question_text: What is the integral value of x which satisfy the inequality -1 < 3 -2x \(\leq\) 5?
subject: mathematics
explanation: -1 < 3 -2x and 3 - 2x \(\leq\) 52x < 3 + 1 and -2x \(\leq\) 5 - 32x < 4 and -2x \(\leq\) 2x < 2 and x \(\geq\) 2/-2 = x \(\geq\) -1If -1 \(\leq\) x < 2it implies that x = -1, 0, 1

question_text: Given that the first and forth terms of G.P are 6 and 162 respectively, find the sum of the first three terms of the progression
subject: mathematics

question_text: If the operation *  on the set of integers is defined by p * Q = \(\sqrt{pq}\), find the value of 4 * ( 8 * 32).

question_text: Find the remainder when 3x3 + 5x2 - 11x + 4 is divided by x + 3

question_text: Factorize completely ac - 2bc - a + 4b2
subject: mathematics

question_text: Find the sum to infinity of the series 1/2 , 1/6, 1/18, .....
subject: mathematics

question_text: The length L of a simple pendulum varies directly as the square of its period T. If a pendulum with period 4 sec. is 64 cm long, find the length of pendulum whose period is 9 sec
subject: mathematics

question_text: Three teachers shared a packet of chalk. The first teacher got 2/5 of the chalk and the second teacher received 2/15 of the remainder. What fraction the the third teacher receive?
subject: mathematics
explanation: First teacher received  \(\frac{2}{5}\) ∴Remainder \(= 1 - \frac{2}{5} = \frac{3}{5}\)2nd teacher received; \(\frac{2}{15} of \frac{3}{5} = \frac{2}{15} \times \frac{3}{5} = \frac{2}{25}\)3rd teacher will receive; \(1-\frac{2}{5}-\frac{2}{25}=\frac{25-10-2}{15}\\=\frac{13}{25}\)

question_text: The shaded area in the diagram above is represented by
subject: mathematics
explanation: Coordinates of the line are (x1 y1)(0,2) respectively and (x2 y2)(2,0) respectivelyGradient (m) of the line = (y2 - y1) / (x2 - x1) = (0-6) / (2-0) = -6/2= -3Equation of the line y-y1 = m(x-x1)y - 6 = -3(x - 0)y - 6 = -3xy + 3x = 6inequality; from the y axis, the shaded region is below the line ∴ y + 3x ∠ 6 and line is a broken line

question_text: PQRSTV is a regular polygon of side 7 cm inscribed in a circle. Find the circumference of the circle PQRSTV.
subject: mathematics
explanation: Each interior Angle of the polygon =(n-2)180_n=(6-2)180_6= 4 x 30 = 120\(^{\circ}\)i.e ∠PQR = 120\(^{\circ}\) ∴ RQD = 120/2 = 60\(^{\circ}\) also ∴ Δ QOR is equilateral Δ ∴ QO = 7cm∴ PO = QO = RO ...... = 7cm radius of the circumference of the circle = 2πr= 2 x 22/7 x 7/1= 44 cm
